answers.text:
Hi Gregory, 
I have rounded up many resources from the Knowledge Network on alcohol and underage drinking that may be useful to your member. Unfortunately we do not have any documents at the time that discuss specifically video monitoring liquor stores so hopefully other Knowledge Network users will be able to chime in on that and help your member out. 
-As for Fake IDs there is an article that talks about the Cops in Shops program. http://icma.org/en/Article/10158/Underage_Drinking_Targeted_During_Cops_in_Shops_Effort
-This article discusses some of the efforts made by Novi, MI to reduce underage drinking in the community. http://icma.org/en/Article/10751/Novi_Youth_CouncilPreparing_Tomorrows_Leaders
-Here is an alcohol and drug policy on the Knowledge Network. icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/5073
-While these are for spring break these alcohol policies and resources are likely applicable to this local government's situation http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/blogs/blogpost/2243/Alcohol_Safety_Resources_for_Spring_Break
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern 
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Gregory Stopka
text:
One of our members has had several high profile cases at different bars recently and are looking for some best practice information from other communities in managing alcohol consumption.  They are specifically looking for whether or not there are any communities that have requirements for the use of, placement of, the monitoring of camera systems, and policies dealing with cameras in liquor establishments.  Also, are there any communities that offer any sort of incentive to licensed establishments for catching, confiscating and turning in fake ID’s?
Any help is greatly appreciated.
Thanks,
Greg Stopka
Central Regional Director
title: Policies for Camera System at Liquor Establishments
